Uses of Class
lexa.core.expression.Expression

  • Packages that use Expression 
    Package Description
    lexa.core.expression
    Provides the classes for expression evaluation.
    lexa.core.expression.function
    Provides functional support for Expression parsing.
    lexa.core.expression.map
    This provides expression based data sets for the Lexa Expression engine.
    lxexpression  

    • Uses of Expression in lexa.core.expression

      Subclasses of Expression in lexa.core.expression 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Add
      Add the results of multiple expressions.
      class  Assign
      Assign a value within an expression.
      (package private) class  Compare
      Compare the results of two Expression evaluations.
      class  Conditional
      An expression that performs a conditional branch.
      class  Divide
      Divide the results of two expressions.
      class  Element
      Represent an expression as a single element
      An element can either be a literal value or an ID to a {see DataItem} to look up in the DataSet during evaluation.
      class  ExpressionList 
      class  Function 
      (package private) class  LogicalAnd
      Perform a logical AND on the results from the expressions.
      (package private) class  LogicalOr
      Perform a logical OR on the results from the expressions.
      class  Modulus
      Find the modulus of two expressions.
      class  MultipleExpression
      An expression that combines two or more expressions.
      class  Multiply
      Multiply the results of multiple expressions.
      class  Negative
      A negative expression.
      class  Not
      A NOT expression.
      class  Numeric
      Base class for numeric expressions.
      class  Power
      Raise the result of an expression by an exponent.

      Subtract the results of multiple expressions.
      class  Sum
      Subtract the results of multiple expressions.
      class  Value
      Represent an expression to return a value
